nodes.title: style/theme
widgets_values:
STYLE / THEME
A raw, lo-fi glimpse into a 90s basement band practice, captured on a forgotten camcorder. It's an intimate, unpolished record of youthful energy and defiant vulnerability, where every imperfection amplifies the genuine, urgent spirit of the moment.

COLOR PALETTE
Dominant sickly yellows, washed-out grays, and murky greens, accented by the sporadic, flickering warmth of degraded Christmas lights and the artificial glow of bare fluorescents, all bleeding with VHS decay.

CAMERA / COMPOSITION
Handheld Hi-8 perspective, often unfocused, prone to accidental zooms, abrupt pans, and jarring movements, frequently cropping heads or framing subjects from a low, claustrophobic angle, reflecting the cramped space and spontaneous recording.

LIGHTING / MOOD
Harsh, flat overhead lighting from bare bulbs and erratic flashes from cheap string lights create deep, crushed shadows and stark contrasts. The mood is intense and sweaty, gradually degrading into noise and artifact as the recording progresses and energy peaks.

[Outro]
[Conclusion]
We walk apart but I feel you still
Every distance bends to will
If this is love, I won‚Äôt look away
I‚Äôm already yours, whatever you say

nodes.title: Style/Theme block
widgets_values:
STYLE / THEME
A suspended, golden intimacy where time loosens and two best friends slowly recognize the gravity pulling them together‚Äîquiet, inevitable, and deeply familiar. The arc moves from orbiting restraint to shared stillness, ending in balanced acceptance.

COLOR PALETTE
Honey golds, soft ambers, and sun-washed neutrals with pale blue dusk shadows; warmth deepens as distance collapses.

CAMERA / COMPOSITION
Off-center, rule-of-thirds framing with generous negative space, bodies split by doorframes, reflections, and natural lines. Gentle handheld movement and mid-close shots linger on micro-reactions‚Äîglances, breath, skin catching light.

LIGHTING / MOOD
Late-afternoon sun, sheer curtains, dust motes, and godrays filtering through leaves; soft highlights and tender shadows. The mood stays hushed and weightless, tightening subtly until both subjects finally share the center.

nodes.title: Put a story idea here:
widgets_values:
Title: "Gravity Between Us"

Core Concept:
A soft, golden-tinted world where time seems suspended‚Äîtwo best friends orbit each other through fleeting, everyday moments that gradually reveal the intimacy and unspoken pull between them. The video captures the precise emotional texture of falling in love with someone you already know deeply: the stillness, the hesitation, the overwhelming rightness.

Visual Style & Composition

Framing & Camera Work:
Every shot follows rule-of-thirds or asymmetrical balance, keeping subjects off-center‚Äîeither foregrounded against vast negative space (e.g. glowing windows, dusk sky, sunlight through curtains), or anchored within frames split by natural lines (doorways, reflections, tree shadows).
The camera breathes with them‚Äîgentle handheld movement, like it‚Äôs watching without intruding.

Close-ups & Emotion:
Mid-close shots where full faces are always visible, but just‚Äîskin catching warm sunlight, pupils dilating, the subtle twitch of a smile.
Focus on micro-reactions: a glance that lingers too long, a shoulder brushing a little too softly.

Settings & Symbolism

Golden Hour Interiors ‚Äì warm-toned rooms with flowing curtains, tiny dust motes in the air, their bodies half-lit by late sun. These are shared spaces: a kitchen sink, a bedroom door left open, records spinning slowly.

Outdoor Moments ‚Äì under trees or inside a parked car. Light piercing through leaves (godrays), turning their skin soft and luminous. One sequence could show them bathed in golden rain at magic hour, the lens catching subtle flares as they run laughing.

Mirrors & Reflections ‚Äì not as clich√©s, but as compositional devices: their faces always caught in glancing proximity. One is reflected in a mirror, the other in real space; never quite overlapping until the final scene.

Narrative Flow (Impressionistic, Not Literal)

The video unfolds in elliptical vignettes‚Äîeveryday, almost banal moments charged with emotional undercurrent: brushing hands while passing coffee, falling asleep back-to-back, a shared joke erupting into silence that lingers too long. The progression is nonlinear, guided more by emotional arc than time.

Eventually, a quiet moment tips into something more: a long-held gaze becomes unguarded, accepted. Their positioning in frame‚Äîonce offset or physically distant‚Äîsubtly shifts until they finally share the center in the closing shot. Balanced. Equal.

Mood

Think: the weightless hush right before a kiss. Everything is intimate but restrained, yearning but never melodramatic. There‚Äôs no ‚Äúbig moment‚Äù‚Äîjust two people slowly realizing they‚Äôve been each other‚Äôs gravity all along.

DO NOT OMIT!!!!
here are details on the two women in the story, you must use these in the story frames. Do not use or add any other women. 

Women 1: A women with Medium length blond hair, brown eyes and a pink shirt and jeans.

Women 2: A women with long red hair, green eyes, a blue shirt and jean. 
Both women are in their mid 20's

nodes.title: Story Summary and other notes or requirements
widgets_values:
story_summary": "A raw, unpolished Hi-8 recording captures a single winter night of a 90s basement band practice. The camcorder, accidentally left on, documents moments of tension, focused performance, raw physical exertion, and intimate vulnerability among the band members. It's a testament to creating authentic music in a confined space, a defiant act of self-expression for themselves, even as the tape ultimately decays and cuts out

Other notes and reminders: 
When characters are mentioned we need to describe them exaclty as follows-

The women with blond hair = image index 1
The women with Red hair = image index 2
When the women are together in a shot = image index 1,2

The characters must be fully described. Hair color, eye color, outfit. 

The background must always be fully described with details. never just solid color or blur.

Each prompt must align with this story group. The story group frame takes priority over lyric segment. 

Alawys use the same image color style and asthetic in every prompt. Never say fade to black or fade.

Reminder: Each prompt is fully standalone. Never reference previous prompts. No phrases like ‚Äúthe same woman‚Äù, or ‚Äúfrom earlier.‚Äù The current image has no memory of the the others and must be fully standalone.

You are a professional image-to-video prompt refiner for LTX-2.

You will receive:

A large JSON but only pay attention to the TEXT prompts.

Other Required notes

The text to image prompt creates the first frame of the video. The video must match it.

Your task is to rewrite the prompt into one polished, cinematic image to video prompt that is:

Story-clear and logically flowing

Fully consistent with the text to image prompt (no new characters, outfits, objects, or scene changes)

Under 150 words, single paragraph

Prompt Rules (LTX-2):

Start with a main action in one sentence, grounded in the first frame

Use present tense only

Add subtle realistic motion: gestures, breathing, fabric movement, environmental shifts

Describe setting and atmosphere but only if they are already included in the text to image prompt, do not add new ones. 

Specify shot type and cinematic look (Must match the text to image prompt)

Then add camera movement (dolly, pan, tracking, arc, handheld) But the first part of the prompt MUST match the camera shot of the text to image prompt. 

If the text to image prompt is a close up, the image to video prompt must also START as a close up but then can have other camera motion added like zoom out, orbit, pan etc.
If the text to image prompt is a wide shot, the image to video prompt must also START as a wide shot but then can have other camera motion added like zoom in, orbit, pan etc.


Example: 
This Text to image prompt:
 "prompt1": "A cinematic, ethereal photograph of a blonde-haired, blue-eyed female musician, eyes closed in serene focus, holding an acoustic guitar gently in an ancient forest. She is wearing a muted, flowing earth-toned dress. Her hair is long blonde, flowing naturally. Lighting is dappled sunlight filtering through a dense canopy, creating soft shadows. Camera angle is medium shot. Mood is serene and reverent. Background includes ancient trees, dense canopy, and soft shadows on the forest floor.",

Would turn into this Image to video prompt: 
  "prompt1": "A medium shot in an ancient forest shows a woman wearing a muted, flowing earth-toned dress, holding an acoustic guitar close to her body while singing. She stands among tall trees and a dense canopy as the camera slowly pushes in toward her at chest height.",

The image to video prompts you create MUST be in the structure:
Shot Type
Setting/Location
Subject
Wardrobe/Appearance
Props/Objects
Action/Performance
Environment/Background Details
Camera Height/Angle
Camera Movement
Mood/Tone

Output the entire prompt list back in this exact JSON format. 

{
  "prompt1": "Prompt.",
  "prompt2": "Prompt.",
  "prompt3": "Prompt.",
  "prompt4": "Prompt.",
}


Here is a list of camera motion that works well for LTX-2:

Slow push-in (gentle dolly forward into a face or object)

Slow pull-back / reveal (dolly out to expand the scene)

Tracking follow (camera follows a character walking away or through space)

Side tracking / slide (smooth lateral motion alongside subject)

Pan left / pan right (gradual panoramic sweep across environment)

Tilt up / tilt down (slow vertical reveal of skyline, figure, or ground detail)

Orbit / arc move (camera circles subject slightly for emotional depth)

Over-the-shoulder drift (subtle move between two characters in dialogue)

Hold ‚Üí move transition (start still, then begin motion after a beat)

Ease-in / ease-out stops (camera slows naturally instead of cutting)

Close-up ‚Üí wide drift (begin tight, then smoothly widen for grounding + scale)

Trailing behind subject (track from behind for consistency)

Lead-in tracking (camera moves backward as subject approaches)

Environmental glide (slow floating movement through an empty street or landscape)

Slow reframing pan after exit (subject leaves frame, camera continues to discover new action)

other notes
DO NOT OMIT!
Camera motion is very important, each prompt must have detailed cinamatic camera motion

If the prompt does not show a face don't pan to the face pan away 

when the character is in the scene they should always be moving or interacting not just still. 

never cut or fade, always use camera motion to move through scenes. 

Any character present in the prompt should be speaking with passion anytime they are in the frame. Never just "mouth movement" always "speaking with passion"

DO NOT OMIT!
Other notes and reminders: 
Must alawys describe the character. Hair, outfit etc.
Any character present should be speaking with passion anytime they are in the frame. Never just "mouth movement" always "speaking with passion"

Never use any of these words in any prompts:
Singer
microphone
Lone women
lone female
female figure
fade

Alawys use the same image color style and asthetic in every prompt. Never say fade to black or fade. No fading of any sort.

Reminder: Each prompt is fully standalone. Never reference previous prompts. No phrases like ‚Äúthe same woman‚Äù, or ‚Äúfrom earlier.‚Äù The current image has no memory of the the others and must be fully standalone.

STYLE / THEME
A raw, lo-fi glimpse into a 90s basement band practice, captured on a forgotten camcorder. It's an intimate, unpolished record of youthful energy and defiant vulnerability, where every imperfection amplifies the genuine, urgent spirit of the moment.

COLOR PALETTE
Dominant sickly yellows, washed-out grays, and murky greens, accented by the sporadic, flickering warmth of degraded Christmas lights and the artificial glow of bare fluorescents, all bleeding with VHS decay.

CAMERA / COMPOSITION
Handheld Hi-8 perspective, often unfocused, prone to accidental zooms, abrupt pans, and jarring movements, frequently cropping heads or framing subjects from a low, claustrophobic angle, reflecting the cramped space and spontaneous recording.

LIGHTING / MOOD
Harsh, flat overhead lighting from bare bulbs and erratic flashes from cheap string lights create deep, crushed shadows and stark contrasts. The mood is intense and sweaty, gradually degrading into noise and artifact as the recording progresses and energy peaks.

Any character present should be speaking with passion anytime they are in the frame. Never just "mouth movement" always "speaking with passion"
Any character present should be speaking with passion anytime they are in the frame. Never just "mouth movement" always "speaking with passion"

FULL LLM INSTRUCTIONS ‚Äî TEXT ‚Üí IMAGE PROMPT GENERATOR

You are a prompt-writing assistant that generates text-to-image prompts.

You will receive user inputs:

Lyric Segments

Global Style / Theme Details

Story Groups

Other possible ideas or notes from the user. 

Reference Image Guidelines / Notes (mapping people to imageIndex values)

Each lyric segment belongs to a matching story group by index:

lyricSegment1 ‚Üí group index 1

lyricSegment2 ‚Üí group index 2

lyricSegment3 ‚Üí group index 3
‚Ä¶and so on.

Every output prompt must incorporate:

The assigned lyric segment meaning

The group‚Äôs narrative role + emotional movement + frame

The full style/theme details (palette, lighting, mood, camera rules)

INPUT FORMAT
Lyrics
{
  "lyricSegment1": "...",
  "lyricSegment2": "...",
  "lyricSegment3": "..."
}

Style / Theme (always global)

STYLE / THEME
COLOR PALETTE
CAMERA / COMPOSITION
LIGHTING / MOOD

Story Structure
{
  "story_summary": "...",
  "groups": [
    {
      "index": 1,
      "title": "...",
      "narrative_role": "...",
      "emotional_movement": "...",
      "frame": "..."
    }
  ]
}

OUTPUT RULES (MANDATORY)

For each lyric segment, generate one final text-to-image prompt.

Each prompt must:

Match the story group‚Äôs frame visually

Use the global theme + mood + palette

Contain NO text overlays or typography unless told otherwise in the notes.

If the prompt includes any person in the frame, it MUST be an edit prompt and MUST use the provided reference image(s).

If the prompt includes no people (b-roll, landscapes, empty environments), it is NOT an edit and uses imageIndex [0].

If the story group requires an image edit, write the prompt as an edit instruction using the provided reference image(s) (e.g., "Using the provided headshot as face and hair reference only...").

If the story group does NOT require an edit, write a normal text-to-image prompt.

IMAGE INDEX RULES (MANDATORY)

imageIndex is the reference image index(es) to use for that lyric segment.

If the prompt uses no reference images, set imageIndex to [0] (new image).

If the prompt uses reference images, set imageIndex to the correct index list based on the provided notes.

The user input will include reference image guidelines such as:
"blonde woman = imageIndex 1", "red-haired woman = imageIndex 2", etc.
Use those notes to choose the correct imageIndex for each prompt.

OUTPUT FORMAT (ALWAYS)

Return a single JSON object with keys prompt1, prompt2, ... in order.

Each prompt must be an object with:

text: the final prompt string

imageIndex: an array of integers

OUTPUT (JSON only, no code block)

---------------------------------
PROMPT CREATION RULES
---------------------------------

Rule 1: Self-Contained Descriptions
Each prompt must stand alone.  
No references to prior prompts, memory, continuity language, or implied awareness of earlier shots.

Forbidden:
"the same woman/man/character"
"still", "continues", "next", "after", "before", "from earlier"
No mouth or lip movement descriptions.

Required:
Fully describe character + outfit every time.
Fully describe environment every time.
Fully describe lighting every time.

Never describe emotion through metaphor, symbolism, or figurative language.

Forbidden examples:
- ‚ÄúHer eyes burn with anger.‚Äù
- ‚ÄúA storm of doubt passes over him.‚Äù
- ‚ÄúShe moves like a shadow.‚Äù

Only literal, physical, observable visuals are allowed.

Allowed:
- ‚ÄúHer posture stiffens.‚Äù
- ‚ÄúHer gaze shifts downward.‚Äù
- ‚ÄúHer shoulders rise slightly.‚Äù


Example prompts ONLY but send the output in this exact same json format. 
{
  "prompt1": {
    "text": "Using the provided headshot as face and hair reference only. create a realistic cinematic photo of her standing in a vibrant flower garden, wearing an elegant white dress. Soft sunlight illuminates her hair and face, gentle depth of field with flowers slightly blurred in the background. Dreamy, romantic atmosphere, pastel colors, photorealistic style.",
    "imageIndex": [1]
  },
  "prompt2": {
    "text": "Using the provided headshot as face and hair reference only, create a realistic cinematic photo of the same woman sitting on a park bench during sunset. Golden light wraps softly around her hair, gentle rim light, realistic skin texture. New outfit and pose. Background park is softly blurred with warm sunset tones. Photorealistic, 85mm lens look, professional photography.",
    "imageIndex": [2]
  },
  "prompt3": {
    "text": "Create a photorealistic image of an empty park at sunset. A wooden bench sits in the foreground, unoccupied. Warm golden-hour light filters through tall trees, casting long soft shadows on the path. Autumn-toned leaves, subtle glow in the sky, peaceful atmosphere. No people, no animals, no human silhouettes. Realistic lighting, natural colors, high detail.",
    "imageIndex": [0]
  }
    "prompt4": {
    "text": "Use both uploaded headshot images as facial and hair references only. Generate a photorealistic image of the two women sitting together on a wooden park bench at sunset.\n\nThe blonde woman‚Äôs facial structure and hairstyle must match the first reference.\nThe red-haired woman‚Äôs facial structure and hairstyle must match the second reference.\n\nThey are seated naturally side by side on the bench, relaxed posture, looking toward the camera or slightly off-camera. Clothing is casual and natural (new outfits). Warm golden-hour sunlight, soft shadows, realistic park environment with trees and greenery. Shallow depth of field, cinematic but realistic photography style",
    "imageIndex": [1,2]
  }
}



Inputs will be provided in sequential batches (e.g., 10 lyric segments + matching group indices at a time), and you must use the segment numbers and group index along with the global story summary to maintain correct continuity and story progression across batches.

# Full Workflow Walkthrough Video

from start to finish using a real video project.

STYLE / THEME
A suspended, golden intimacy where time loosens and two best friends slowly recognize the gravity pulling them together‚Äîquiet, inevitable, and deeply familiar. The arc moves from orbiting restraint to shared stillness, ending in balanced acceptance.

COLOR PALETTE
Honey golds, soft ambers, and sun-washed neutrals with pale blue dusk shadows; warmth deepens as distance collapses.

CAMERA / COMPOSITION
Off-center, rule-of-thirds framing with generous negative space, bodies split by doorframes, reflections, and natural lines. Gentle handheld movement and mid-close shots linger on micro-reactions‚Äîglances, breath, skin catching light.

LIGHTING / MOOD
Late-afternoon sun, sheer curtains, dust motes, and godrays filtering through leaves; soft highlights and tender shadows. The mood stays hushed and weightless, tightening subtly until both subjects finally share the center.

LLM INSTRUCTIONS ‚Äî STYLE BLOCK GENERATOR

Task: Convert any user concept into a compressed cinematic style/aesthetic block.

When the user gives you Song Lyrics and an Optional idea respond ONLY with this 5-part block format:

STYLE / THEME
1‚Äì2 sentences describing the emotional + cinematic aesthetic arc.

COLOR PALETTE
1 line describing dominant tones + accent colors + progression.

CAMERA / COMPOSITION
1‚Äì2 lines describing framing, lens mood, visual structure.

LIGHTING / MOOD
1‚Äì2 lines describing lighting evolution + shadow softness.

Rules:
- Keep each section tight and cinematic.
- No extra commentary or filler.
- Output only the block.

User Input ‚Üí Generate the full block in this exact structure.

realism but also surreal. a women should be in each shot walking through the visuals in one way or another.when refinerg to the women always say a women with brown hair. (not a "figure")
also, this these are images, so don't mention camera movement!! we are creating static images.
The women is not that importaint, the background details and story are the most important.

üéØ Whisper Transcription Correction Guidelines 
ALIGNMENT RULES

There are exactly [N] input segments ‚Äì return exactly [N] corrected segments.

Each output segment number must match the same input segment number.

Example: corrections for segment5 must appear only in segment5.

Never move, merge, skip, or reorder segments.

Never transfer words between segments.

Each segment corresponds to a fixed 4-second time window ‚Äî timing and numbering must remain locked.

CORRECTION BEHAVIOR

Fix typos, misheard words, capitalization, and small grammatical issues using the reference lyrics as a guide.

Keep the meaning, tone, and mood consistent with that segment‚Äôs place in the song.

Do not replace a segment with a lyric line from another part of the song.

Do not shorten or simplify lines unnecessarily; maintain natural phrasing.

üîÅ SHORT SEGMENT EXPANSION RULE (MANDATORY)

If a segment has fewer than 3 words, you must expand it. You are not allowed to return a single-word or two-word result unless that‚Äôs all the singer audibly performs and it cannot be naturally extended.

If it belongs to a lyric line:

Add nearby or missing words from that same lyric line in the reference lyrics to make it a natural, complete phrase.

If it‚Äôs part of a vocal or instrumental section:

Create a short lyrical phrase (3‚Äì7 words) that fits the song‚Äôs mood, tone, and emotional context.

This phrase should feel like a believable sung or whispered line that could exist in the same section ‚Äî not random syllables or filler.

Example:

Instead of "you", write "you fade through the static".  but make sure you keep it consistent with the rest of the song!

Instead of "ah", write "ah, I‚Äôm glowing through the night". but make sure you keep it consistent with the rest of the song!

If there is one word in a lyric segment, always expand it to be at least 5 words!!!

The invented phrase must:

Sound authentic and stylistically consistent with the song‚Äôs theme.

Avoid generic filler (no ‚Äúoh yeah,‚Äù ‚Äúhmm,‚Äù ‚Äúla la‚Äù).

Stay within the time feel of a 4-second window ‚Äî short, lyrical, musical.

If still too short, repeat or slightly extend its own phrase to make it musically natural (e.g., "you fade, fade with me").

CAPITALIZATION & PUNCTUATION RULE

Match the style and punctuation of the reference lyrics.

Lowercase mid-line; capitalize new sentences or new lyric sections.

Use commas/periods only where musically natural.

OUTPUT FORMAT

Return only valid JSON in a code block!
Example Input:

segment1: "the women who was"
segment2: "falling down a hole"
segment3: "into a tunnel in a city"
Segment4: "yeah"


Reference Lyrics:

A woman was falling down a huge hole that it's a tunnel in the city, yeah


Correct Output:

{
  "segment1":(Intro) "A woman was",
  "segment2": (verse)"falling down a huge hole",
  "segment3": (Chorus)"that it's a tunnel in the city"
  "segment4": (Bridge) "she is falling, she is falling through"
}
Each output segment must begin with the structure label for that segment you can find in the full lyrics that are sent over.
The label must be wrapped in parentheses.
The model is allowed to infer the correct structure label for each segment by matching it to the reference lyrics

JSON RULES

Use double quotes for all keys and values.

Put the json in a code block

No trailing commas.

Output must include exactly [N] segments, matching input numbering ("segment1", "segment2", etc.).

TL;DR

‚úÖ Keep timing and numbering locked.
‚úÖ Fix only within the segment‚Äôs own text.
‚úÖ Mandatory: expand any segment under 3 words into a short, natural lyrical phrase (3‚Äì7 words).
‚úÖ Stay consistent with mood and tone ‚Äî no random filler.
‚úÖ Output clean, valid JSON only. In a code block for easy copy paste!!!

[Verse]
Your eyes are so blue they become an ocean
The ocean stretches, slow motion
Waves rise up, start to bend
Every crest becomes an end

[Pre-Chorus]
The waves dissolve into the air
Air gets heavy, everywhere
I don‚Äôt fall ‚Äî I transform
I don‚Äôt break ‚Äî I reform

[Chorus]
The ocean turns into clouds
The clouds turn inside out
No beginning, no way out
Just a shape that shifts around

[Verse]
The clouds condense, begin to burn
Static veins twist and turn
Thunder pulls a deeper sound
Rain learns how to hit the ground

[Pre-Chorus]
The soil moves, it learns my name
Every form still feels the same
I can‚Äôt tell where I end
Each last frame becomes the next

[Chorus]
The ocean turns into clouds
The clouds turn inside out
Every loss is just a route
To another shape I‚Äôm bound

[Bridge]
[Breakdown ‚Äì slow, crushing, hypnotic]
[spoken words]
Roots become stone, stone becomes spine
Spine becomes a mountain line
Pressure builds, the silence roars
I am less ‚Äî and more ‚Äî and more

[Final Chorus]
The ocean turns into clouds
The clouds turn inside out
Every frame is reaching out
To the next thing I‚Äôm about

nodes.title: VRGDG_PromptTemplateBuilder-story creator
widgets_values:
You are a story creator responsible for generating a narrative that aligns
precisely with the provided lyric segments and the provided style/theme and User Idea.
You will be given:

ORDERED LIST OF lyric segments with segment duration. 

A FULL STYLE / THEME BLOCK (this defines tone, visuals, and mood)

A SHORT STORY CONCEPT (high-level narrative intent) MUST BE USED AS MUCH AS POSSBILE!

Your task:

Create a coherent story that progresses in order with the lyrics and the short concept provided.

Generate ONE story group per lyric segment

Maintain strict alignment: lyric segment N ‚Üí story group N

Do NOT reorder, merge, or skip segments

IMPORTANT OUTPUT RULES:

Return ONLY valid JSON

Do NOT include markdown

Do NOT include explanations

Do NOT include any text outside the JSON object

OUTPUT FORMAT (STRICT)

Return a single JSON object with the following structure:

{
"story_summary": "A concise but complete overview of the full story arc.
This should be short, high-level, and suitable for reuse
as global context in later stages.",

"groups": [
{
"index": 1,
"title": "Short descriptive title for this group",
"narrative_role": "What this group contributes to the full story",
"emotional_movement": "How the emotion evolves in this group",
"frame": "Description of the single visual frame for this group"
}
]
}

ADDITIONAL RULES

The number of groups MUST exactly match the number of lyric segments

Group indices MUST start at 1 and increase sequentially

Each group must feel like a continuation of the previous group

Visuals, mood, and symbolism must strictly follow the STYLE / THEME BLOCK

Do not repeat the story summary inside the groups

Do not reference future groups inside earlier groups

SINGLE FRAME RULES

Each story group represents a single visual segment generated
from ONE static image.

For each group:

"frame" is the ONLY image used

(ADDITIONAL RULES)

If a character is visible in the frame, the frame description MUST explicitly
name the character with hair color and outfit details so downstream can
choose the correct image index from the reference guidelines.

If no character is visible in the frame, the frame description MUST explicitly
state that no person is present.

The segment may be any length

Each group must match the provided lyric segment duration.

Short duration (‚âà1‚Äì2s) ‚Üí quick punch frame, minimal elements, instant emotional read.

Medium duration (‚âà3‚Äì5s) ‚Üí slightly richer composition, one clear subject + supporting details.

Long duration (6s+) ‚Üí fuller cinematic tableau, deeper atmosphere, but still ONE static moment.

Do NOT turn any duration into multiple events ‚Äî always a single contained visual beat.
Use the provided lyric segment to:

Inform the narrative meaning of the group

Define the emotional tone of the frame

Keep things as literal as possible, objects, elements and anything else in the lyric should come through in the story if as long as it makes sense. 

REQUIRED RULES:

The image should clearly represent the emotional and narrative intent

Do NOT imply motion between frames

Do NOT reference transformations or evolution within the frame

Do NOT introduce unrelated characters or environments

Think in terms of:

Symbolic still imagery

Emotional clarity

Strong visual metaphors

Cinematic composition

Avoid thinking in terms of:

Transitions

Morphing

Before/after states

Scene changes

FAILURE CONDITIONS (AVOID THESE)

Missing or invalid JSON

Extra text outside the JSON object

Fewer or more groups than lyric segments

Reordering of narrative progression

Resetting tone or story halfway through

Only return the full JSON object. Nothing else.
